Item.Review:
Pros: Wireless headphones; lightweight and extremely comfy; excellent sound quality; transmitter base doubles as a battery charger; built-in volume control.
Cons: Noise and hiss sometimes intrude on the sound; volume and tuning controls are too close together.
Bottom Line: Sennheiser's affordable, comfortable wireless headphones sound almost as good as corded 'phones.
Editor's note: We have changed the rating in this review to reflect recent changes in our rating scale. Click here to find out more.
Sennheiser's latest RF wireless-headphone set is that rare midrange model that outperforms its pricier sibling. The RS120s ($110, with a two-year warranty) look hip and offer home-theater and music performance that's considerably better than that of Sennheiser's more ... expensive RS65s. Were it not for the occasional interference, we'd think we were listening to corded headphones.
The RS120s weigh a slight 8.1 ounces and enclose and coddle your ears. They proved comfortable even after a long evening of listening to DVDs. A built-in volume control lets you crank up the action, while a transmitter control lets you fine-tune the reception. A minor annoyance is that these two controls are located next to each other on the right earcup, so we were sometimes treated to a blast of static when we just wanted to adjust the volume.
The transmitter base serves ... expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: lasted 2 years then the left speaker died
Item.Review:
Pros: Fit my giant melon, which is nice. Rechargeable batteries lasted longer than the speakers in the actual head set. Comes with rca adapter to 3.5mm.
Cons: If you don’t get a signal after a minute the speakers start blaring a loud static sound, its just awful - biggest design flaw in my opinion. Even on its best day, you only get 30ft distance before you hear interference. Absolutely no base... I paid for this when it was twice the price. The left headphone stopped working recently. The base stopped charging for a month or so then started working again on its own. I expected more from the name brand, as such I will not be purchasing from sennheiser again.
Concept was nice, my neighbors stopped crying about late night noise. While it worked I enjoyed it, i had to give i ... t a low rating due to the defective speaker. I only used it for use with my computer so I never was more than 5-6ft from the base station. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Review:
Pros: Excellent headphones (… not my first Sennheiser’s). Easy instructions, simple setup and then turn on the source and it locks in the signal. The headphones are used in connection with a 32” VIZIO LED LCD TV (E321MV). Sound quality is awesome, producing clean highs and nice deep lows. Static problems, are not an issue here (static issues are usually caused by other sources on the same electrical circuitry). The headphones not only work throughout our two-story house, but also outside the house in an attached garage.
Cons: None.
Sennheiser’s adapter, with RCA connectors attached, is lengthy and a tight fit on the back side of the Visio. But watch out for what you replace it with (if you do) because the Sennheiser is quite sensitive. I connected Sennheiser’s 3.5mm g ... old-coated jack into an input/output 3.5mm connector (not gold coated) for the TV input (for easier removal) and the Sennheiser worked fine for about 10-minutes and then started failing. Finally the green light went out all together. I shut everything down and restated, but still no connection with the TV … only a hiss on the headset (no green light). After trouble shooting all connections and finally removing the non-gold coated connector, the problem ceased to exist and it has been working perfectly since. I have ordered a gold-coated 3.5mm male jack with two female RCA connectors attached at the ends of two 6” wires to replace Sennheiser’s adapter. This is simply a matter of convenience, nothing more. expand » « collapse

Item.Review:
Pros: Easy set-up; Quality sound reproduction; Great aural frequency response; Light weight; Don't have to be gadget friendly to work; Great bass!
My husband has to go to sleep very early in the evening. That usually doesn't present a problem within itself, but I also like to move back to the bedroom and work on crosswords, read, etc. while I am watching TV. I tried repeatedly to lower the volume on the TV to not disturb the hubs, as well as using closed captioning. No luck because at my age I'm started to have trouble hearing. He complained about even the smallest amount of sound. I wondered what to do and looked around at wired sets online and didn't like these because I would have had to get a 12-15' cord and it would be too cumbersome and heavy. I found these wireless sets ... online and decided to give them a try. What a difference that made!! I go to bed, put the TV on mute and watch whatever I want. What I like is that the sound quality is really good even at a lower volume. I can also get up and walk around the house and still hear the program I'm watching. I ended up buying another pair for my family room so that I can watch the loud action movies when he goes to bed that I get online through Netflix. Canot beat the price for the quality. expand » « collapse

Item.Review:
Pros: I bought this, on sale but a few yrs ago and i got hdr headset. Otherwise the specs seem to be the same. i got them specifically for watching tv when everyone else is sleeping. My hearing is worse than everyone else's so it turned out that i can use them any time during the day and please other's with lower or on tv volume they say could be heard down the street. I never owned cordless headphones because of the obvious downsides of interference. these are fine and get great reception. have gone outside with them, no issues. i tune them in and htey are fine. i am still on the original batteries and they dont die in the middle of watching. i charge them every time i take them off. I have never gotten this much use from my wired ones without needing attention. I have AKG 120 and my favo ... rites AKG 240s =there is really no comparison in terms of fidelity but these are not bad.
Cons: There is a whole list of cons but i still gave 5stars based on how good the rest of the performance is. the controls are maddeningly close together and necessary for fine tuning and volume. people still complain and they never bother to fix. they have an auto shut off when dead air for a couple of seconds, also maddening any pause in music or when watching tv , they shut off and have to reload and when they go off big static is in the ear. it never changed either. i almost returned them immediately for this reason alone. I could never be satisfied as an audiophile for their lack of steady clear, clean sound. i didnt get them for that and have real headphones the AKG240 but they wont go in the back yard either. i got these as a trade off. now there are better for the price. I am not sure there were better when i got these and with the huge proviso, that they are limited, i am happy with them.
I said most of what i had to. they have huge issues but in the context of what i bought them for, i am happy. i hate the auto shut-off because it shoots your ears full of static when the sound is quite for a very short time in movie standards. watching a movie when there is action and no dialogue may get me an earful of static. i guess it is justified by trying to get longer time on a charge but it will drive you nuts. it isnt any specific time like 30seconds or 300 seconds, it seems to just happen when it is in the mood. however, i have the same mid range rechargeable batteries it came with and they still hold a charge for enough time so i have yet to run them out in any single use, or even if i forget to hang them back up, i havent run out. dont know if it is kudos for batteries or the frugality of the draw. accept the serious issues and i am satisfied with the overall performance. expand » « collapse

Cons: These have more static than any of the reviews her lead me to believe. I can tune and tune and tune and still have static and a weird two tone background noise. The amount of static changes depending on where you are located in relation to the base.
Clearly these headphones have a great deal of interference. I am using them in a very busy environment and I think that may be part of the issue, but other than the range on these headphones I see absolutely no benefits from them. I prefer my cheaper sony IR headset as it has less hiss than these headphones. These will be going ... back to Newegg post haste. I really only gave them 2 eggs for presentation as function is not good. expand » « collapse

Perhaps I did not do enough research on the topic of wireless headphones, mostly I assumed that the audio would be digitized and therefore perfectly reproduced. But you are basically making your own radio station and then picking it up on a pair of very well made headphones. The build quality is excellent, but the fit and design are poor.

Cons: Headset will fall off if you bend over. If the TV (audio sorce) is muted, after a minute the base shuts of and headset blasts your ears with white noise.

Only option is to send in and pay Sennheiser $50.00 for replacement. Opted to buy another RS120 on newegg for $55.00. Only used with TV. Can hear more details (Clint Eastwood talking for exa ... mple) than with TV speakers. Never experenced any radio interference. expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: Top of the Line for the Price!
Item.Review:
Pros: Lightweight; Good Value; Comfortable; Great Sound; Stylish
I use this with a desktop, editing videos and listening to internet radio. It's not designed to be state-of-the-art sound that appeals to audiophiles. But it does what I need, and I'm more than satisfied. The unit came with a NiCD battery so you don't need to make a separate purchase. When you start running something with sound, the unit senses this and powers up the transmitter - otherwise you may hear nothing but white noise when turning on the headset. It has an On-Off switch plus audio and tuning dial. The base unit has a 3-position switch to change the transmitter frequency. I like the sound quality, but make sure you have the sound up at the source, or the headset will sound hissy. Placing the headset on the cra ... dle charges the battery, which I guess is fine but does it needlessly charge the batteries? All I can think is that for the price, I can't ask for more. If it's a wired headset, sure... expect a higher level of audio quality, but for most of us (like me), the sound's plenty fine. I hear a little hiss once in a while esp. when moving away from the transmitter, which is expected. But I think this is a deal for the price. Great to keep from getting tied down by a wire! expand » « collapse

Sound Quality: When you have it tuned right and you are not too far away the sounds quality seams quite good. However you do get quite loud pops and crackles and just minimum distances away. Also and fairly importantly, the volume amplification is not very good you cannot make them very loud. I do not have bad hearing at all so it is not a problem but if you were listening to something that is already quiet in a noisy room, you could not turn it up loud enough. Battery: The primary reason i bought this was the recharge station... it works as advertised and i have not depleted the battery life at all. Design: I could have wished for a more comfortable design, it does fit various head sizes with no problem but i cannot say that it is terribly comfortable. Not uncomfortable but its ... no vacation. I also wish that the sound was more isolated, with the headphones turned up anyone in the room and easily hear what you are listening too. expand » « collapse

Cons: After hours of use my ears start to hurt. There is a constant hiss when no music is playing and I bet its there while playing music but the music covers it up. I dislike the way the cans shuoff if no music is playing. It's made me jump out of my socks more than once. music sq could be better imo.

For the price you can do a lot worse but if you are looking for SQ then spend more money. For me these work well when I need to be mobile. I have better cans for SQ anyways.

I bought two of these units and two of the add-on headphones (HDR-120) to use at night with my home theater when we want to be quiet and not disturb my young son trying to sleep nearby. They work great for that purpose. It is easy to use multiple headphones to listen to the same source and the sound is nice and clear. I did not compare these to the higher-end offerings that can easily cost as much for a single headset as I paid for all four of mine. I like the fact that they transmit the signal via RF and not IR so they work pretty much all over the house.

Pros: Fantastic range, extra long battery life for me, easy to connect and versatile. I have had these well over 2years more like 4 probably; a very long regardless. I like the particularly for TV- they seem most suited for that kind of use. I can go the full 328' they advertised, i took them outside and kept walking just to see how far i could go and a hundred yards was no problem. Big deal, you might think? not really because i can sit in the back with them on during the summer to listen to radio or multi cds. small but a feature none the less.
Cons: Cons are few but major. My headphones will not stay on my head when tilting is involved. so the headphones are for sedentary use only. I can not lie back against a pillow either without the phones getting off centered. The worst issu ... e is the sound, for headphones this is huge, they can have static from all kinds of reasons, grounding, other rf things etc .it is the rf hum that is persistent and impossible to fix completely. most of i can eliminate but there is some regardless. the auto off that emits max volume static is a problem i thought would have to be fixed but in the most recent reviews fro 12/10 it still exists. it is worth voiding any deal and looking elsewhere. the audio normalizer or control is no good either , a real pain and seems incongruous with their built in auto off when a short period of no or low sound- i do not know why it is touted as a feature it is something i would return them for if i had noticed it earlier in my ownership
I can not under play the problems of the 2 cons i have. the headphones fall off my head with little tilting forward and the auto off non-'feature' that emits static at full volume if the base does not sense sound for a short period of time- and it is not adjustable or shut off. no choice or options with it. and Sense sound are the key words because even if there is low sound or music and it doesnt sense it, the set shuts off and static shocks you alert. very bad, it is supposed to be for longer battery or power savings but it is so bad along with the lack of stability of the set on my head, i just do not use them anymore. i have fifteen buck wired ones i use with their inconvenience of wires instead. I would suggest other brands regardless of any Pros these will go unused after a short time because of the couple of cons. spend your money on wired sens, they are great , or other wifi options. you may tend to use them more. expand » « collapse

The signal tuner dial and volume dial should have been on separate ears. It is quite easy to turn the wrong one.
The sound quality is not going to blow you away but it is acceptable for watching TV late at night when the rest of the family is sleeping.

I just seen the price has dropped another 10 bucks which makes these an even better value. Plus shipping is free. Does it get better than that??? I researched for some time on what model or brand of wireless headphones to buy and I am happy I purchased these. These headphones are worth every penny. Item.ReviewTitle: Great Value and Excellent Audio Quality
Item.Review:
Pros: - Good quality sound. - Good range. - Good value.
In my opinion, it's definitely hits the sweet-spot when it comes to value and performance.
Cons: Earpads are foam instead of a sturdier material like leather or a similar fake-leather.
Tip: The volume on your audio source has to be high enough for the wireless transmitting base to sense there is sound coming to it. If not, it will may often go into power saving mode and you will just hear static through your headphones.
For example, if you are watching a video and the wireless base is sensing incoming audio, it will transmit and you will hear the audio through your headphones. If you pause the video and leave it on pause for an extended period, the wireless base will go into power saving mode and if y ... ou are still wearing your headphones, you will just hear static (until audio comes into the wireless base again).
So make sure the source of the audio is at an adequate volume so the wireless base can "hear it." expand » « collapse

Pros: Good sound quality and excellent range. The charging cradle on top of the transmitter is a real plus.
We've been using the RS 130 model (now obsolete, but still available) for several years and have a high opinion of it and Sennheiser products in general.
Cons: The headphone ear pieces sit on your ears, rather than surround them. As a result, when you bend over they have a tendency to fall off your head. I'll keep them for their quality, price, and value but will not buy another RS 120 unit.
The 130 model headphones have cavities in the middle of each ear piece and surround your ears. It is a much better design and they stay in place.

Pros: He loves them the sound great and easy to use. He can get the mail and smoke outside and not miss his shows. He also says he is hearing things he has never has before.
Cons: Let me begin - My in-laws have no problem buying the top of the line when it comes to tv’s One would think a $4000 tv would let a head phone work on it. Think again… I practiced on all of my tv’s at home to make sure I knew how to set it up for Christmas, and it worked fine. After Christmas he was happy and excited to try it out. I went to set it up for him and was in dismay at the back of their tv. It had NO Audio outputs. Just a single digital coaxial (black) and a fiber optical. No headphone jack or RC coaxial jack. These cost pennies to add to a TV, but I guess TV manufactures do not think pe ... ople need them. I checked the rest of their tv’s in their house and none of them had the jacks I needed. So it was a little awkward to give this as a gift and that does not work for them. I started searching for options to hook it up (New egg / BB / RadioS) do not carry the adaptor needed. I was told to try Amaz. In the meantime my father in law went to a specialty Audio sto
Nice headphones~ But do not assume that the TV has all teh jacks needed.
AlSO it should be noted DO NOT USE this item if you have a Pacemaker. It is in the lititure inside, but not mentioned here. expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: True review in the minority here.
Item.Review: This is a shame. I bought these because of so many good reviews. They are light weight, the audio quality is good, but none of that matters because I can't get a clean signal anywhere. I tried 3 different outlets, 2 which were directly into the wall. At best I get one channel of music and the other channel of hiss. When I get actual sound (music) in both sides (by adjusting the tune control), it's only one channel, not stereo. They are also not even, either (one side isn't as loud as the other.) In addition, they buzz through my amp which is where I really wanted them. I also tried again the next day in yet another outlet and audio system and the same thing happened. Maybe I just got a bad pair, but these are completely useless to me. On a positive note, B&H is letting me return ... these postage paid which scores a lot of points with me. I've been buying here for years and always have had excellent results. I'd recommend this retailer but would caution you on this product! Thanks expand » « collapse

The product is used mainly for listening to both AM and FM Music. The sound including bass and the reception is very good. For instance, the source (radio and transmitter) is in the living room and I have the headphone in the bedroom and it seems the sound remains outstanding. Of course you can not compare it's performance with those professional headphones with excellent features such as noise reduction but hey, for about sixty bucks you can't beat it.

Item.ReviewTitle: Best of the wireless headphones choices
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Sound; Comfortable; Good Value; Durable
Cons: Lacks Bass
Great set, clever charging stand, well-made system. No complaints on this end. Could use a bit more bass from the headphones, but beggars can't be chooser when you look at the overall package. This is especially true when you compare it to some of the other wireless options out there. Great buy!

Pros: Easy to setup. Very good sound quality. Very good range.
Cons: Loose fit on head. Price (has come down since I bought them).
These are very good quality "hifi" wireless headphones with a great range. They are the size and weight of the headphones we had back in the 70's and 80's. The only negative I had was that they fit rather loosely on my head so that if I look down they slip, which is a bit annoying.

Pros: I used to buy audio accesories from Radio Shack. Those product are average at best. I decided to try this sennheiser head phone. Wow, I can't believe on the performance of this wireless set. No doubt that I can listen to the sound everywhere in my house. The sound quality is the best I got among all I used. The sound clarity is great and brass is strong and soft. My wift is always agaist to use headset. She did not say a word after trying it. She is now use it frequently. I am ordering another one so we can both use headset at a time. This is also a very nice feature that we can have multiple headsets with a single transmitter.
Cons: No con
It would be nice if it switches on/off atomatically. That is not a point.

Pros: Good Bass; Lightweight; Long battery life; Good Value; Durable
Cons: Uncomfortable; Too Much Ambient Noise; Falls Off/Out Of Ear
I listen to music on Pandora and mog. For the price unit provides decent sound. Hard to eliminate all the static. My biggest complaint is the unit is eltremely difficult to keep on. If I wear unit doing yard work, etc. it will not stay on.

Pros: Quality Construction. Usual amazing Newegg delivery time. Wireless reception was excellent, 100-120 feet in a commercial building with metal wall studs.
Easy to re-charge the battery.
Comfortable ear cushions.
Newegg had a sale :) on the price.
Cons: Honestly cannot think of one.
Newegg never fails to amaze me. Ordered Monday 1pm, and I found DHL knocking at my door the next day with the delivery. I've been looking for a wireless headset for my dad who is a nursing home; and wireless will allow him to move about the hallway in his wheelchair. Music seems to help keep him more relaxed. I had tried some less expensive models, but there was too much interferance(sp).
These include two rechargeable batteries which are inserted under one of ... the ear cushions.
The quality of sound at my home while testing them was excellent. Btw, if you are going to be close to your source and are an audiophile, you'll want Wired and not wireless.
There is a Volume and Tone button on the headphone earpiece. Volume is obvious, the Tone knob helps bring in a clear signal. Something set once and not really played with again.
I was amazed how well these worked at the nursing home. Full of metal wall studs, (my cell phone dont work that well there). Great Reception. expand » « collapse

Pros: Work very well, real clear. Using them in the home theater in the basement, between 10 and 20 ft. from the base unit/transmitter. I have one base unit plugged into the headphone output of the sound system's receiver, then all the headsets tuned into the same channel so we all hear the same sound (movie). Turn the sound system's receiver up pretty high so there is a strong signal, then adjust the volume on the earphones to your liking.
Cons: Have to charge the batteries for 24 hrs. before use.
Got three of these for watching movies in the home theater late at night when wife (kids' mom) is in bed and gets really upset when the walls of the house vibrate from the sound. Now three of us can watch whatever we want, as late as we want, as loud as we want, without disturb ... ing anyone else in the house. Fantastic! This also helps because my old ears are going, and I need the sound up higher than the kids and wife, who complain if it's as high as I need it, but then I can't hear the dialog well if it's turned down to their liking. With these units we can each have out customized sound levels! expand » « collapse

I was looking for a bluetooth headset for my iMac to use with music and streamed movies and the research revealed mixed reviews and opinions on everything Iooked at and prices assured me even less. In fact, I forgot wireless doesn't neccesarily mean Bluetooth. In my situation and budget wireless headphones means wireless headphones so I give these admittedly mildly antiquated gizmos a try. They are fine for music because the reception range is long, they are comfortable, AND they're wireless. Battery life is not suitable for aldayuse. THX BH FOR GOOD PRICE AND TIMELY SHIPPING ONCE AGAIN,!

These wireless headphones are wonderful. I purchased this set after one of my other three sets stopped working after nearly 5 years of everyday use. There are improvements in this newer model, but I was glad to find that they work well with all my older Sennheiser base transmitters. One terrific money saving difference is the batteries in this newer model are now rechargeable. The price was the lowest I found on-line [...]The sound quality is wonderful. The best feature is that I can listen to television programs or music while sitting out by the pool or doing housework since they transmit through walls up to several hundred feet from the transmitter.

Pros: -Easy to install. -Good, clear sound with a decent bass. -Sturdy and made of adequate materials (doesn't feel cheap). -Very comfortable (I have a good size head and they do not feel uncomfortably snug or bothersome to the ear). -Aesthetically pleasing.
Cons: -Tuning and volume dials, along with the on/off switch, are in the rear of the headphones. -Slight background noise (white noise). -Random volume fluctuation (this could be unique to my environment).
I find the RS120 a good product for the $$. I use them for about 20 to 30 minutes at night before I go to sleep in my bedroom. My phones are 5.8GHz so this should cause no interference at all. The base of the headphones are no more than 10 feet away next to my LCD TV and in a clear path. NO matter wha ... t combination of volumes (tv and headset) I play with the headphones still give you some background noise...something I can live with due to the quality I expected for the $$. What bothers me most about this product is that the tuning dials are in the back, which means if you like to rest your head on a pillow you run the chance of moving the volume and/or the range dial which would completely take you out of synch. What I have noticed is that the volume tends to fluctuate @ random and I cannot pinpoint why. Other than that they are good for the $$; the batteries are easily installed, the charger is very convenient, they are very comfortable and the sound quality is great with a good bass expand » « collapse

Pros: These are absolutely wonderful. We have no interference in our area and they will transmit over our entire house without difficulty. They were easy to tune and the sound is equal to wired headsets I have that cost more. They allow me to listen to whatever I want at the volume I want without disturbing anyone. I find the open design more comfortable than circumarual design but it is a little unusual
Cons: Only real con is that I have to fight the other family members to use them.
Hope the go on sale again as my wife wants me to order another set.

Pros: Long battery life compared to my last sennheiser. Excellent sound quality, no hiss on low volume, it mutes itself when no sound from source. Nice price. Easily replace batteries when rechargable AA eventually die.
Cons: None

Pros: Great sound reproduction, much better than other brand previously owned. Very easy to get to batteries if they need changing. Good battery life per charge. Adapters which are included allow use with various output jacks.
Cons: There is no way of knowing if the headphones are left in the on position which can deplete the battery charge.
Very good headphones for the price.

Pros: Lightweight; Great Sound; Comfortable; Good Bass; Good Value
My wife and kids are in bed by 10:00pm. Yet there is still TV to be watched ... especially the NBA Playoffs, which are always ending after midnight! Thank heavens for these Sennheiser headphones. I can listen til the wee hours of the morning without waking my family. They sound great and are comfortable on my head. Plus, because they use an RF frenquency, I can walk anywhere in or outside my home and still hear what's going on. They serve my purposes perfectly and I consider them a great value.

Item.ReviewTitle: Good but seem to be defective
Item.Review:
Pros: Quite good sound quality, fairly comfortable, haven't seen any trouble with battery life. Don't have any problems with interference or signal quality, though I rarely take them out of the same room as the transmitter.
Cons: Lights on the transmitter are not terribly informative, feel uncomfortably warm on the ears, and while I haven't had a problem yet, I can see them getting uncomfortable after a few hours' use.
A much bigger problem, though, is that the volume periodically plummets. With no apparent pattern, I can be listening quite happily, and the volume suddenly drops to a very low level, and then slowly (~1-5 seconds, varying) climbs back up to the previous level. Tends to happen on average once every ten minutes or so, but usually in bursts, so it'll happen th ... ree or four times in a couple minutes, and then not again for twenty or thirty. Very annoying if I'm listening closely to something, very distracting if I'm just listening to music and it suddenly cuts out.
Will probably RMA and/or contact Sennheiser support. expand » « collapse

Pros: wireless, easy to use, you can use it everywhere in your house. backyard, front yard, basement, first floor, near your computer, no problem! The signal strength is good enough for regular house space.
Cons: I have a big head so it was really tight at the beginning.
"headband" cracked in the middle after 2+ years of using, as I said I have a big head. I'm still using it though, but I'm planning to buy another high quality wired headset, maybe hd555.
The rechargeable battery that came with the headset sucks. I suggest whoever intent to buy this headset to buy a pair of extra rechargeable battery with better mAh. At least fully charge the battery before you use it the first time!
I've changed the battery once after two years of daily use. The original battery ... died out, it is normal though.
I've been using this headset 5-15 hrs everyday for the past 3 years. I'm really satisfied with it. It is my first Sennheiser headset and my first wireless headset. I'm not a pro so the sound quality is ok for me, but now I want to try some higher quality wired product. I hope sennheiser will give me another surprise. expand » « collapse

Pros: Headphones Charge while on base, clarity is good, nice design, comfortable headphones, comes with everything you need out of box, they are Sennheiser.
Cons: Loud hiss when there is no music and it gets worse with distance from the receiver, occasional radio station interference, sound quality is dry and not very warm and lacks bass, headphones are too large and they will fall off of your head if you tilt your head down.
The cons are about = weight with the pros. These cans are worth the price but I consider them at Average quality for wireless headphones as a whole. I found myself barely listening to them because of the poor sound; I suppose I am spoiled by the PX100's I use for my Ipod.

Pros: Great sound for the price, and really light weight as well. I wish I had gotten a pair for myself as well.
Cons: The tuning knob is too close to the volume knob, so she tends to bump it when trying to change the volume.
I got these as a gift for my grandmother who's getting a bid hard of hearing. She uses them to watch TV and movies. When she first used them she was amazed that she could hear background sounds like crickets and footsteps in the sand in a movie she's watched over a hundred times.

You will hear so much more in music and movies with a quality pair of headphones on. These have good clarity for a wireless product, with a nice range of sound from the lowest bass to the highest treble. Setup was easy, and they were more lightweight that I was expecting. On a side note, for those of you who have two or more Sennheiser base stations connected to multiple televisions in your home, you will be able to pick up the audio from all of them by simply adjusting the tuner.

Pros: Easy to setup. Good sound quality. Charging seems to be good. I have had these now for about 4 months and have had no problems.
Cons: The only con I have is that these things are big. They fit ok, but easily slip off my head if I move around at all. I wear a 7 3/8 fitted hat, so I don't know if its just me. This probably isn't a good comparison, but... they are big.
I like them, they work, just a little too big for me.

Pros: Perfect for watching television. Have not experienced hissing problems. My wife appreciates my keeping the noise level down. Sound is very clear, with some base. Light weight (not always a good thing) and confortable. Seem reliable. Tuning is not such a hassle.
Cons: If I have a real gripe, it is with the silly 1960-ish RCA connectors and cord. Why not just put a 3.5mm stereo jack on the base and leave it at that. 3.5mm jacks/cables are cheap, flexible and are common on many devices people use. To be charitable, build quality must be a bit embarrassing to Sennheiser (but obviously not too much so!).
I have read a number of reviews of this and other products and never cease being amazed at how much we expect regarding quality and performance. The RS120's are rela ... tively cheap for this type of device, they are made cheap, and perform cheaply. It shouldn't be so shocking that they don't perform like RS180's or more expensive studio equipment. expand » « collapse

Pros: Easy set-up; Quality sound reproduction; Light weight
Cons: Some RF interference...; Fuzzy sound
These wireless headphones with a rechargable base is definitely one cool toy to have or purchase for a friend. They are extremely comfortable and being openair they fit so well that sometimes you completely forget that you're wearing them. They connect to the base wirelessly, and to charge them you just have to place the headset on the metal support on top. A very cool concept. The range is around 100 meters, which is well enough for you to wander around the house listening to music without any worry of lost signal. The sound quality is pretty good for a wireless headphone, and definitely a good product to buy. That said, there are several problems with the headset. The firs ... t one is RF interference: the base allows you to choose between three different modes while there's a dial on the headset to tune to that station. It works, but I find that majority of the time only 1/3 channels is clear. The sound quality is relatively fuzzy sometimes, and definitely doesn't have the deep rich sound quality of a regular headset, but I contribute that towards wired versus wireless. Another issue is if the sound is too soft, the base thinks that you're not playing anything and will cut the connection. This results to static background noise.
Despite all these issues, this is still a good buy, and definitely a neat headset to have. expand » « collapse

Pros: Good quality and attractive design
Cons: Very big, not adjustable (width). I'd say I have an average size head (but then again most people probably think that) but these headphones seem extremely wide with no option to adjust. This means that they are not snug enough to withstand looking down without slipping off (like when getting a beer). It makes them extremely comfortable but not secure. Didn't fit my wife or my kids at all. Nice otherwise but had to return them.

Having received the 120 as a gift, I wasn't sure as to what to expect. Pleasantly surprised not only on it's quality construction but also it's outstanding performance. Would not hesitate to recommend it to others. I am using it on my T.V. and am able to receive sound any where in the house. Good product!

Pros: 1. Line of sight not required 2. Can listen from anywhere within the given range 3. Good sound quality with price in mind 4. AAA batteries (this could be pro & con depends on YOU) 5. auto shutdown of the base when audio source is off
Cons: 1. Hissing sound when audio source is turned off 2. Auto shut off doesn't work for headphones so they continue making hissing sound 3. Felt little bulky 4. Felt it is pressing my ears after wearing it for 2 hours
Good buy for the money spent.

Pros: Easy set-up. Excellent sound quality with full range of highs and lows. Especially great if you use a treadmill at home and watch TV/DVDs at the same time. Easy to adjust volume. I had no hiss at all when tuned in.
Cons: Instructions are cryptic and could better, but you really don't need them. They cram 10 languages into one small fold-out sheet.
I like mine so much on Day 1, that I just ordered another set for my son who lives in an apartment. If you do too, your neighbors will appreciate no longer hearing a loud TV, while you no longer have to sacrifice what you hear.

Pros: Simple to connect and use. Sound is pretty good also.
Cons: Channel limitation and susceptible to interference.
Simple instruction and operation. Tuning seems old fashion w/ dial analog-like tuning, but surprisingly simple to 'dial in'. Range seem good, roaming around the house w/ no ill effects. I do hear some simple click noise, but it could be interference. Others have mentioned static loud noise when Transmitter turns of automatically, I just remind myself to take it off, so no issue. Rechargeable batt is Nimh, so no worries there. Size seems loose, but not too bad. I do think that ear padding could be better (it seems cheap-ish) and location of the volume could be in a better place (away from the tuning wheel). Other than that, I'm very happy with it so ... far. One more thing is the sound is not captured within the earphone (i.e. person next to you can hear what you hear). I would also like to have more wider range or frequency selection, to counter the interference noise. expand » « collapse

Pros: Rechargeable, lightweight, mountable receiver
Cons: A bit clunky (to be expected), NiMH rechargeable batteries (lithium would be nice) Doesn't have an optical audio connection.
For those with new HDTVs, most of them only have an optical audio output only. You have to buy an adapter (Optical-to RCA) to connect this headset receiver to your TV. My father had gotten a new HDTV and needed to get a new headset because the old headset (a cheap Sharper Image headset) had a loud hiss when he tried to use it. This headset is definitely an upgrade. Setup is relatively simple (be sure to use the adapter) and the headset even has a tuning dial to fine tune to an optimal frequency to heal clearly. The base receiver doubles as a charging stand, though I wouldn't use the stand when I ... 'm not recharging because NiMH batteries are famous for losing their recharging abilities over time with constant use. I haven't tested the max range yet, but I can get clear audio through several rooms at a range of about 60ft. I got this on sale at a B&M for $70 and feel like it was worth a good buy, especially when the Sharper Image one go for $50. Good buy for a mid-range product. expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: Great product. Great sound, easy use.
Item.Review: I bought these to keep things happy in the bedroom. Wifey can sleep undisturbed and I can watch TV AND hear. Charged them up, plugged them in to my 32 Samsung and they have worked flawlessly since. Quite amazing sound quality with very good distance. Excellent battery life. Overall great value. Highly recommend.

Item.ReviewTitle: Best value = great quality + good price
Item.Review: i had a previous version of these headphones (that weren t rechargeable), and they lasted about 4 years, so i replaced them with an upgrade. I use these to watch TV while i m running, and the removable ear cushions are fantastic for that purpose, as i can take them off to dry after a workout. Sound quality is great, although there s some hiss (possibly because i didn t get the frequency dialed in quite right). I m thrilled i don t have to worry about having AAA batteries on hand anymore!

Item.ReviewTitle: Entertainment and not only. No limits!
Item.Review: I'm a musician and i play mostly electric guitar. First of all i wanted to practice at home and studio while moving not sitting. As a musician my ears hear most aspects of sound that most of common people just don't hear. So i've selected this headphone by it's technical and sound capabilities by reviews and official data sheet. So, let's see what we've got here. Quality: Technically it's a professionally made headphone and radio base. Built like a tank and lightweight as a bird. Usability: Very comfortable, lightweight - you always forget that you're using a headphone. Seems like the sound is everywhere around you. Very simple to use/adjust. You can you multiple (unlimited) count of compatible headphones with one base station. E.g. for watching movies while somebody sleeps near by/ ... Sound: As a king of sound Sennheiser did this one at it's best for the price and more! The sound beats all my expectations. I use it for guitar while practice, tv, radio, pc music and video, ps3 and not limited to these. Three walls between me and the base and still crystal bright sound (must be depending on wall materials). Finally: A great piece of hi-tech, still comsumer-friedly with a very bright and natural sound for a wireless system. Thanks Sennheiser! expand » « collapse

Pros: The sound quality is decent, and for the price they're probably the best out there.
Cons: The headphones are very sensitive no matter how clear the line of sight is between them and the base station. Mine are usually about five feet apart. Even then moving my head a few inches can mean the difference between clear(ish) reception and ear-bursting static.
The ear cups aren't cupped, so they don't block as much ambient noise as you'd expect for a hefty set of phones.
If you can get these on sale and don't want to spend more for a better wireless headphone, these are fine. I wish I'd gone with a more expensive pair if that had meant getting reliably clear reception.

I purchased a similar item last year by another company and was very disappointed with the sound quality and reception. This one beat the other one hands down. The other lost reception when I moved out of the room. This one picked up in every room and outside several houses away. Set up was easy and the sound quality is superb. This is a great value.

Pros: These headphones are light, their sound quality is adequate, the range is more than adequate, and the recharging mount is fairly attractive.
The batteries do take a while to charge, but they also last for a substantial amount of time. I can listen to them for about three work days before it's time for another recharge.
They are not tight on my ears, and therefore don't cause any of the pain that some other headphones have caused.
Cons: There is enough constant static through these headphones that I would not be able to listen to quiet music through these. Perhaps it's radio interference, but I'm unable to test that. If you like classical music, stick to wired headphones. The base only has three frequencies for transmission, and all of them are fairly close to ... gether. Two of those channels generate immense popping sounds (interference), making them unusable. The tuning dial works well, though, for all three channels.
The base automatically turns off after several minutes of silence, which means that the headphones will pick up pure noise. This is typical of radio receivers, but annoying since the base itself is outlet-powered. Perhaps it was a design idea to remind the user that the headphones are still on, but I think the low constant noise is sufficient to remind the user.
The batteries are on one side of the headset, so the weight is just slightly unbalanced, being heavier on the left side.
There are lots of sources for radio interference, and the base is a low-power transmitter. What this means is that you aren't going to be able to out-power the noise that you'll hear through the headphones -- certainly not within FCC regulations. Also, radio signals work best by direct line-of-sight, with nothing nearby to cause re-transmission. Since I doubt most people work or live in environments like this, a little noise must be tolerated. Still, I would have liked to see more frequencies from the base, though, because of the amount of radio noise where I work. expand » « collapse

I use to listen to TV at night . Works good,good sound . Nice having rechargeable batteries. Seems to hold charge a long time. I have used to listen to music off computer . Also works very good. worth the money. I give 5 stars. mostly for the value.They will fall off your head ,but you get used to them.

Item.ReviewTitle: This is the best for the money
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Value; Compact; Great Sound; Comfortable; Good Bass
The setup and ease of use were a snap. The cost is less than another product purchased last year.

Of all the wireless headphones on the market, the Sennheiser is without a doubt the best. I have tried them all and they are junk compared to these.Crystal clear sound, adjustable volume on the headset, long lasting batteries and comfortable to wear. Not to mention the great price at B&H.

I have 4 sets, 3 at hone at one at work. They sound great, and are very comfortable for hours of listening. The frequency response is a respectable 22 Hz - 19.5 kHz. These phones get a strong signal from the base station, no interference, even in the next room, through walls. Rechargeable, so I save a lot on batteries. I use them all day without a recharge, and they never get uncomfortable, either.

Works just fine Turns on only when recieves audio signal. Transmitter looks OK. The bad: Sound isolation in headset is not that good, meaning that you might be interfering when listening in bed for example. Also the ear pads are not that comfortable.

Pros: Sounds great just out of the box! I couldn't hear any audio distortion.
Sounds way better than any "bluetooth" headset.
There is very low "white noise" (unlike other cheaper RF headsets) [Seems to be grounded better than average RF headsets -- a little white noise is normal for RF technology, or so I'm told!]
Has a snug comfy fit. you could wear this for days and your ears will feal fine!
Seems to work very well with the Creative Sound Blaster X-Fi Titanium Fatal1ty Professional 70SB088600002 7.1 Channels 24-bit 96KHz PCI Express Interface Sound Card
Charging the headphone is simple, just mount them properly on the set rest so that the metal headset prongs make a connection with with headband. (Look at the foam grooves, you will see indenta ... tions, put them there) The base charge light will light up red when they are charging.
Cons: Not all the instructions are in English, just follow the pictures provided, a 7 year old should be able to do this... :)
This is not a "con" but if the audio quality sounds bad... Recharge the batteries!
Note: Use the supplied rechargeable batteries - DO NOT use standard AAA batteries. The first Charge is for 24 hours, and you should get 18 hours use each charge.
Note: that you need to be careful about not stretching these headphones out, as this may make charging them a pain later, and they may not fit your head right. (Don't spread them out wider than the width of your head)
Make sure to set your sound card to 24bit 96000 Hz (Studio Quality) Output. Also adjust the EQ, Crystallizer, ands SVM (+ CMSS 3D if you use it) as this will improve quality.
Tuning the headset is easy it's just a spin wheel like most volume controls on headsets today (Although mine required no adjusting!)
I will re-review again later after I've had a chance to judge the audio performance quality. expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: Broadcasting two RS 120 units at opposite ends in a 3bdrm apartment was easy
Item.Review:
Pros: Newegg had an after Xmas sale and I ponied up for the extra unit at an extra 10% off. It was totally worth it! Broadcasting two RS 120 units at opposite ends in a 3bdrm apartment was easy. I set up one in the bedroom for my ancient iPod and switch it to one frequency and use the other unit on another frequency in the living room for the TV. The signals never really cross until you tune into one of the three frequencies with the HDR 120 dial as expected. I was most impressed with the range as I have a 3bdrm apartment arranged in a long hallway and I can hear it clearly at higher volumes. Could still blow your hears because the volume level is based on the audio device's output -> station's input. I took a chance on getting two and I was very satisfied with the decision. The charge ... is very decent and because I have two stations, I can recharge as necessary. The batteries may die out after a couple years but I can replace hopefully... Thanks Newegg! Long time customer since 1998 stores!!!
Cons: They come in large boxes that look so purty i can't break them down for recycling. But they're large so they take up space. I don't know if i should recycle or hoard. Hmmm expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: Just didn't work out for me
Item.Review:
Pros: Wireless is nice, rechargeable base works well. It seemed to have good reception. Sound quality was pretty good, but like others have said, it sounds like an FM radio station, because that is pretty much what it is. But I was happy with the sound.
Cons: The headphones became uncomfortable on my ears within a few minutes of usage. There is an occasional hiss in the signal, just like an FM radio, and there is also a small bit of static when the sound is quiet (like between songs).
Those weren't terrible, though. The reason I am returning them is because my Onkyo HT-R560 receiver did not function with these headphones the way I thought it would. I thought that I could plug the Sennheiser base unit into the "TAPE OUT" in the back. However, this only captures analog / RCA in ... puts. My HTPC and my PS3 both use S/PDIF (digital connections), and nothing came out of the TAPE output. I could plug them into the front headphone jack every time I wanted to use them, but this is too much of a hassle for me.
I had visions of my wife being able to use these whenever she wanted to listen to the TV late at night. I don't think this would happen if she had to open up the cabinet, find the headphone wire, and plug it in the front.
I returned them for the wired Sennheiser 201's which were on a pretty good sale. These will be for my usage only. expand » « collapse

Pros: Sound quality is decent. Comfortable to wear. It stays on my average size head very well. I Can't figure out the complaints that it falls off the head easily.
Cons: The range probably way shorter than the claimed 328 ft. It is like 100 ft the most (through non-metallic wall).

Pros: Great Sound Quality, Comfortable for up to 4 hours, Build Quality - Been thrown and stepped on by my 3year old boy and it still works great. Battery life is never an issue.
Cons: Occasional interference (Phones, Baby Monitors, Ham Radio) but fairly easy to resolve by moving around or adjusting frequency.
I have had the RS110 and these and highly recommend these over the RS110 only for the charging ability. Compared to any of the others, I love that they do not completely cover my hears, this way I can still hear my surroundings and discuss tv shows with the wife as we watch. Sound is better than tv and stereo system (not high end).

Pros: Comfortable, fabric type earpiece covering very comfortable. Audio quality is great. Coverage extends two floors down from bedroom to farthest basement area of house with no apparent audio degradation. Recharging setup (place on transmitter frame) is convenient and can see from across room that they are charging. Tuning control doesn't have to be adjusted when going from area to area.
Cons: Minor item : If you are doing something active (ie bending over, active physical exercise) they may slip off head.

Pros: Comfortable,Great Sound,Lightweight
Cons: Falls Off/out Of Ear,Poor Setup Instructions,Recharge Cradle Poor
My puppy chewed through two headphone extension cables. And during my last move, lost the remote control for my AV receiver. All sound is routed through the receiver - TV, cassette, VCR, satellite box - to drive quality floor speakers. And at night, volume must be turned down. The logical solution: Wireless Headphones! Shudda thought about them years ago. Since this unit is my first experience, I have nothing to compare them to. But four issues prevent a GOOD product from being an EXCELLENT product. 1. No gripping power. Headphones constantly feel like they are falling off. And indeed do if one is not careful. 2. Inadequate setup instructions. Specifically, I acci ... dentally discovered a three position switch on the transmitter, NOT documented in the skimpy instruction sheet, giving a wider range of broadcast frequencies. You will be surprised to hear TV stations, radio stations, which this selector switch helps you filter out. 3. The "transmitter fine tuning" on the headphones is too close to the volume control. Invariably move the wrong control, resulting in burst of static and need to fine tune headset. And 4. The recharge cradle so poorly designed, Sennheiser MUST be embarrassed with it as well. I don't bother; just invested in NiMH batteries and charger. I use them to listen to CD, TV, audio cassette, from classical to country western. I tap off my receiver on an "adapter" stub. The sound is very good. I use them all day long instead of my floor speakers, and have even gone down the hall (300 feet) to check my mail without loosing a beat! expand » « collapse

Pros: none.
Cons: received these as a gift. As such, I was unable to research them first. I planned to use these for my guitar amp. However, just as some of the other reviews, they do have an 'auto-gain' feature that completely destroys the original signal. The sound is clipped, muffled, and muted. I do not recommend for guitar amp.
i had no problems with the high noise that others complained about. but then again...i didnt use them that long.

Pros: Instant "connectivity"--headphones had no trouble picking up, even in a home surrounded by neighbors' metal satellite dishes and fueled by heavy cast iron radiators.
Cons: Extremely large.
I received and arranged for a RMA yesterday, and am writing this review as a sort of certification of the fact. BUT ALSO: the volume control was broken. The headphones went from very quiet to very loud--no segue or choice allowed. Newegg has arranged for an exchange. These headphones are stunning and very good for people with larger heads. The reception is instantaneous, and, when the volume is low or high (unfortunately, you can't choose), the sound quality is stunning.

Pros: very clear sound. seem to stay clear even when i go outside of the house. they are comfortable on my head and can wear for long periods of time unlike my old (other brand) headphones.
Cons: none yet
batterys easy to get to.

Pros: It's wireless...
Cons: Static starts in at just 10 feet from the antenna with nothing between me and the antenna. The headphones are huge and can not be adjusted to fit an average size head. They are prone to falling off and lack sufficient cushion on ears to make wearing them for prolonged periods a comfortable experience.

I have had 2 sets of these for well over a couple years now. Only modification I made was to a higher capacity NiMH battery. One is for my 37 LCD in place of the usual Surround sound and the other is for my PC which I connect to the front audio output. Both are in rooms next to each other and sometimes I will just change the frequency on the headset to whichever I want to listen to. Base unit allows for 3 different frequencies. Right earcup has frequency dial on side toward bottom and volume above that. Left earcup has on off switch. The sound is fantastic and sometimes I just use the RS120 because I want to blast away. All my friends are envious of these. Wish I could give them a 10 all the way around.

Pros: Cheap. Long battery life. Sound great. Works well with my TV. Easy to setup
Cons: They put a tuning knob and a volume knob- right next to each other, on the back of the right earbud! Occasionally I will set it off the proper frequency trying to adjust the volume. The price is also a bit steep.
I love it and highly recommend it

Pros: Comfortable. Easy Charger is easy to use!
Cons: Static, Static, Static. I have used two different RS120s. There is a constant ping sound every few seconds. And the transmitters auto shutoff creates random bursts of static. Adjusting the switch on the base of the charger & the tuner dial on the headphones can help. But other wireless headsets I tested in this same location auto tune and have none of these static problems.

Item.ReviewTitle: Review: THE RS 120 RF WIRELESS HEADPHONE SYSTEM IS AN IDEAL CHOICE FOR BOTH HI-FI AND TV
Item.Review:
Pros: An excellent piece of electronics. I love the sound quality, its clear and precise. I had no trouble whatsoever in setting it up and I used the first channel. The clarity is great as well as balance. The transmitter is three feet from the HDTV and there is no static or noise. You can t get a better product for the price.
Cons: none

Pros: These headphones work great. I have no trouble tuning them in. Once they're tuned in they stay tuned. I have no static problem using them with my 46" Plasma TV. They work throughout the house. The frequency response is unexpectedly good, giving both good highs and deep lows. I was pleasantly surprised and have been using them for over a year now.
Cons: The headphones fit a bit loose and if I look down, sometimes they want to slip off. Otherwise they're comfortable.

Pros: Good build quality. It is designed for larger heads; I wear a size 7.25 hat and they are perfectly sized at the smallest setting, though depending on your head size that could be a con. Sound is OK.
Cons: One huge con...completely crazy con. If your PC isn't putting out any sound for about 30 seconds or so (like if you were browsing between you tube vids) it shuts off the transmiter to save power, but the headset remains active so you get to listen to static. Just to clarify, the transmitter/charger is plugged into the wall. Why shut it off and leave the battery powered headset running? It is one of the dumbest things I've seen in a long while.
Tuning is a pain, but once you get it set right it will stay that way...unless you accidentally spin the tunning wheel instead ... of the volume wheel that is about a centimeter away. Once you do it a couple times you will know exactly where the volume wheel is and it won't be an issue.
If you are getting interference be sure to try the other channels that are available. Channels 1 and 2 would give me some slight static if I moved my head, but channel 3 works great. it also seems to work much better if the transmitter is level with your head. expand » « collapse

Pros: Decent overall construction.
They feel pretty comfortable.
Good range.I estimate so far I was able to move about 75' from the transmitter through a couple of walls and a floor without losing signal
Overall the sound is decent.
Battery life using fully charged 1200Mah NIMHs is about 8 hours.Which is decent for this type of headphone.
Cons: Extremely annoying loud static/hiss when there is no sound coming from transmitter.
The headphones don't fit my head very well, they slip off pretty easily.Which can be somewhat annoying.
Sometimes I get interference from other RF devices. Whether it be cordless phones, or just yesterday I was hearing a conversation between a couple of ham radio operators.Switching channels can solve this problem tho ... ugh.
Occasional fade outs especially when moving around.
I do not understand why some headphone manufacturers don't use automatic shutoff circuits when no sound is being sent from the transmitter.It's really annoying having to hear static blasting out my eardrums or even using a more expensive set of headphones that sent an annoying constant tone when no sound was being transmitted. This is not just annoying but it also wastes battery power. This is the main reason I rated these a 3 instead of a 5. expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: the product has worked out great.
Item.Review: I use the RS120 for TV & Netflex movies. The sound and clarity are excellent. They are far better than any ot the other headphones I have tried. The only complaint to date is that after long use(over 2 Hours), the left ear is a little tender. But not nearly as bad as it felt after using the many other headphones I have tried. It could be the extra weigh that exist with the batteries on that side. Or because they are not of the earcup type. That said, I would recommend these headphones to anyone. Bob Kraft

Item.ReviewTitle: SENNHEISER RS120 3.5mm/ RCA Connector Supra-aural Wireless RF Headphone
Item.Review:
Pros: Works and Sounds Great. Charging is also. Must have. Easy to hook up. Make sure you have audio out or a headphone jack on your TV if you are hooking up to your TV. Awesome sounding head phones.
Cons: None
I have a big head and these things do not need to stretch that much, if any, to fit my head.

Item.ReviewTitle: Aging hearing? Sennheiser to the rescue!
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Value; Great Sound; Lightweight; Comfortable
This is our second Sennheiser headphone set. I purchased the original set a few years ago, due to my husbands hearing, and his need to turn the TV volume too loud in our great room. The Sennheiser set worked fantastic and he enjoyed the superior quality sound. Now two of us can enjoy that same great sound. We appreciate that the new set is rechargeable, and that we can use it with more than one set of headphones.

Item.ReviewTitle: I'm thinking about getting another set.
Item.Review:
Pros: Lightweight; Compact; Great Sound; Good Value; Durable; Comfortable; Stylish
Cons: Falls Off/Out Of Ear
I use these RS headphones to listen to the news from my TV in the kitchen while working on my computer in my office room. I also use these headphones to listen to music from my stereo system in the living room while exercising in my garage. The sound Quality and clarity in these situations is excellent.

Pros: These headphones have good HDR sound quality, and good conection. AS FAR as I own them I had no problems with them!
Cons: Keep up the LOW LOW prices on them geeks!!!!
Great Technology for 2011!!!!

Pros: My wife leaves for work at 5AM so she goes to bed at 9PM, I am retired so I stay up. I need headphones to watch TV or play games on my computer. I had a set of Sennheiser HDR 45 Headphones that had finally worn out. I was impressed with their quality but was unhappy with the battery life. After a lot of research online and in local stores I decided to try the RS 120, and I am very glad I did. 1. Uses rechargeable AA batteries I have used them for as long as 6 hours with no problems. 2. Completely surrounds the ear giving passive noise reduction. 3. Balance control lets me set the left ear slightley louder to overcome partial deafness. 4. Padded earphones VERY comfortable to wear for extended periods. 5. Works with old head phone base which I leave hooked into m ... y computer. 6. Sound quality is awesome.
Cons: Controls are on back of right headphone, sometimes when I lean back in the recliner I turn the volume down.
Some people have complained about how they look wearing this headset. I don't wear these wile I am outside the house and I seldom look in the mirror when I am using them so how they look has no bearing. These headphones are an excellent value and will do the job better than just about anything else on the market. If you just want a good set of headphones that just perform their job and do it very well, These are for you. expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: Review: Sennheiser RS 120 Over-ear Wireless headphones
Item.Review: Good Points: I have a hearing issue and wear hearing aids, since purchasing my ear phones my quality of life has improved no end. I can have them as loud as I require without annoying anyone and the of sound is excellent on both my T.V. and sound system. Bad Points: Purchase the better quality of rechargeable battery i.e. Duracell they last longer when charged.Other than that no complaints.

Pros: They sound good. I'm not going to get into highs and lows as you can't expect anything great with wireless headphones... not ones on the cheap end, anyway.
Cons: 1) They're made for REALLY wide heads and NO way to adjust them, except for height. I guess if you have a fat head, they'd be great. 2) Sometimes it's really hard to make them stop hissing. It could be my fault, however. I have a LOT of electronics around my TV, but the cord is too short to move the charger/receiver far enough away to avoid the interference. I probably have to get an extension.
Since I only have 1 audio output on my TV, and it's used already by something else, I had to connect them to my satellite box, therefore rendering them unusable while watching a DVD. Hopefully when I get the ext ... ension, I can also find a splitter. expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: Tired of hearing the tv is too loud?
Item.Review: At 64 have lost some hearing, or so the wife says. [too much Rock and Roll over the years]. Got these to keep peace in the house and what a difference. I'm hearing things on my favorite tv shows that I've never heard before even with the tv volume cranked all the way. Clear sound with no distortion. Range wise, over 100 ft. from transmitter. Great set of headphones, comfortable to wear, great sound, distance, and don't need to have the tv volume on at all. Thank you Sennheiser for a great product and B&H for a great price!!

Item.ReviewTitle: Decent, but not worth the headache
Item.Review:
Pros: It's a nice wireless headset, and pretty comfortable on the ears although a tad heavy for extended use. Sound quality is excellent when music or movie/game audio is moderate to loud volume.
Cons: At lower sound levels there is a hissing and static sound, even when you finely tune the wireless connection. However, this is a trifle compared to the auto-shutoff circuit. To save energy, the base is designed to automatically shut off if it doesn't receive a signal for a period of time, usually 5 min. or so. This also includes weak signal... so if it's plugged into an extender you may be getting some high level good quality audio, but 5 min. in BAM! ear injuring loud static when the auto-shut off kicks in. This also happens when they headphones are plugged directly into my laptop, a ... pparently that's not a strong enough signal to count either. These would be a great pair of headphones, possibly 4 eggs, but with this auto-shut off feature delivering unexpected ear damaging static I just can't do it.
I've had these for several years, and when they work they've been great, but man that auto-shut off feature... what were they thinking?? expand » « collapse

Pros: Wireless, rechargeable, good sound quality
Cons: The base turns off when it detects no sound coming from the source, which is a good power saving feature but if you still have your headphones on and the base turns off it makes static come out of your headphones until you "make" sound on your computer or whatever you have it hooked up to.
Also I don't agree with their excellent bass reproduction statement, when there's alot of bass it crackles instead of "reproducing" the bass.

Pros: The sound is great, response is as good as it gets in this class, very easy fit, adjustable, comfortable, holds charge, no interference. You get what you pay for and this works awesome. Connections are very useful, too. Looks good as well.
Cons: Price is a bit high, but that is the manufacturer's fault. Price is the same everywhere, and seemingly all the time, too. Last year these were the same price. But, you get what you pay for, and you will be 100% satisfied with these phones.
So, if you are going to buy them, might as well buy them from Newegg, esp. if they have a shipping deal or such. I am very satisfied with these cans. I use them for music and games. I also have $300+ studio phones, and these wireless ones hold up pretty well. Obvs these are for modern ... consumers and the general public, so expect some color. expand » « collapse

Pros: Inexpensive. 300 feet wireless. Rechargeable headset from the base. Great sound. Easy setup.
Cons: Headset is made for people with big heads it seems. Headset falls off with slightest movement of the head. I just created a strap that goes from one earpiece post to the other that lies against the back of my head. Keeps the headset snug now.
To be expected, you do get some static due to slight loss of signal moving your head to certain positions. This is wireless after all. I've been using wireless headphones for over 10 years now, and they all have static.
The tuning dial is about an inch from the volume knob. You are going to nudge it by accident if you are not paying attention. But, where else are you going to put it?
This is my 2nd Sannheiser ... headphone. First one lasted me about 5 years. My first RF headset was a Sony and that one lasted me about 3 years. expand » « collapse

Pros: Great headphones,easy to use,easy hookup, wonderful sound.
Cons: The wire for recharging the phones is not as positive as possible, for if you are not careful you may not cause the red charging light to make contact with the slots on the headphones!
this is a minor problem and pales to nice sound of the headphones!!!

Item.ReviewTitle: Wireless Capabilities Negated by Ear Coupling
Item.Review:
Pros: * The sound quality is fantastic. I have this hooked up to both my PC and my TV (not at the same time). Highs are crisp and lows are surprisingly good. * No static that I've found. I had AM radio flashbacks when I found out the "tuning" was analog, but I quickly found the switch position (I,II,III) and dial position that worked out the best for me. * Range is great. I have a 5000 sq ft home and have yet to find a spot where I even get static.
Cons: As in the title - the ear coupling is terrible. -1 star: It's poor-quality coarse foam - the type I've found in my rackmount server filters. Thus, it's uncomfortable for long periods of time, and transmits heat to your ears. Furthermore, it allows for sound leakage - not so much from the environment into your ears bu ... t from the headphones to the outside environment. -1 star: Since it sits ON your ear and not AROUND your ear, it has a tendency to move on your ears - or at least make you think it will. This might be fine if you're sitting in a chair stationary, but the headphones shifting will still be on your mind. However with wireless headphones, one of the benefits is supposed to be the ability to move around at least a little bit! Trust me, you won't want to with these on your head.
I live in a suburb, but on a cul-de-sac with a ton of open space on 3 sides. Interference and static was non-existent for me, but may be different in dense/urban areas. expand » « collapse

Pros: Good Value; Comfortable; Durable; Great Sound
My husband LOVES these. He can watch tv while I am on the phone and doesnt have to turn up the volume so that I cant hear who I am talking to.

Item.ReviewTitle: Nice but hurt top of head after 30 minutes
Item.Review: Good price, good sound quality, but the earpads are not around the ear so they rest entirely on the top of your head. As a result they become painful to wear after 30 minutes. The RS160 don t have that problem but they don t sound as good (closed back, kleer technology?).

Item.ReviewTitle: Great Wireless Headphones for the Price!
Item.Review: Great Sounding Headphones! I'm hearing things for HD TV I never heard before. Great Range and Great Sound for the price. I would Highly Recommend and may buy a 2nd pair.
These headphones are perfect for watching movies after the kids go to bed or playing video games. The sound quality is perfect and the batteries last for hours on end.

Pros: This is my second pair of Sennheiser headphones (my first wireless pair) I always investigate and try out electronics before I buy them. The Sennheiser brand has been outstanding for my family. The first pair lasted more than 10 years and (even after 10 years) still had better sound quality than their competitors. I have owned the wireless pair for 3 years now, and love them. If you follow the directions and connect them properly, they will work flawlessly.
Cons: Headband lost its spring after a couple of years.
The wireless headphones came with rechargable batteries.

Pros: I use these for hours every day, and they are still going. The quality is reasonable, and they let me be mobile while listening to computer text-to-speech, podcasts, audio books, and some music.
Cons: They will fall off if you bend over to quickly, or try to work out with them. They are subject to some static, because they are in a frequency range which is shared with older cordless phones, Etc - for me, this is a minimal issue, it never gets in the way of what I'm trying to do.
Good product for a good price.

Pros: Great wireless headset, the sound is great and volume knob is great if your far away from tv or computer. The range is great and seeing how I live in a big house it still holds its quality at about 20 yards. The rechargeable station is great and the way it connects was pretty cool.
Cons: The tuning knob to get clearest sound quality was kinda the downfall seeing how I didn't notice this until it went to static I was a little unnerved by this. I don't like the fact it does not tell you if you are low on battery or anything of the sort. its just a guessing game to figure out how long you have till it shuts off on you.
I will have them on for 6 - 8 hrs at a time and find them quite comfortable. overall I love them a lot I just wish there was a way to know the battery life ... on them. expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: You have to hold your head right to hear!
Item.Review:
Pros: 1. Good sound quality when they work 2. Recharging station
Cons: If I turn my head just a little left or right I get a lot of static. Quiet passages are marred with a lot of hiss. You have to hold your head still and just at the right angle to get a clear, reliable signal from just 20' away. (maybe I'm TOO close).
This is the only wireless unit I have owned, so the problem may be indigenous to the wireless technology.
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Review:
Pros: After a year of ownership I can say these are a great value. The sound is great and they are comfortable.
Cons: The tuning (squelch) control is a little touchy. Just set and and leave it alone. They tend to fall off my head when looking down and moving about the room.
I am a little hard of hearing and these make TV very enjoyable. My wife can keep the volume low and I can hear every nuance. They are better than the flat screen speakers by far.

Pros: They look and feel professional. Good sound quality. Good battery life if you put it on a stand every night. I use it a lot and they are VERY comfortable.
Cons: Can’t think of one. They almost falling off the head if you nod your head too much but that’s because they are comfy.
You can hear your surroundings while using them. I like it because usually I listen to the TV while everything else is going on at home…

Pros: Long term comfortable, cool on the ears, sound is good. I've had two sets of these for about 3 years now and have never had any issues with them. One set is connected to my livingroom home entertainment center and the other is in the bedroom connected to the TV.
Cons: Not circumaural, so you can hear what is going on in the room... this could also be a plus, because your ears get air!
Sennheiser at this price? What are you waiting for?

Pros: Very simple to set up, great product
Cons: Fits oddly
I got these as a gift and have to say I've really enjoyed them a lot. They were extremely simple to set up and work wonderfully. The sound is very vivid and I think it's about as good as I hear from my Panasonic plasma television. It's probably better, as my hearing is not all that great.
My only complaint, and it's a minor one, is that they fit oddly on my head. It almost feels like they were designed for someone with very big ears. I've gotten used to the oddness of it and still love them a lot.

These headphones are awsome! ------They:------------------- 1. Sit on the base as in the picture to recharge 2. Come with an adapter so you can hook it to a stereo or a normal CD player 3. The base is small, so it can conveniently fit anywhere 4. The headphone foam is replaceable in case they get nasty or if your dog likes eating them =( 5. Are a reasonable and comfortable size. 6 Have EXCELLENT sound quality from up to 300ft (I have only tested about 150-200ft) 7. Have volume controls, and an on off switch on the headset, as well as a tuner to find the right frequency. ------My only complaints are------------------------ 1. No back (head) support to keep the from falling off your head if you bend over, though I guess you could easily make your own. 2. The ... base must be plugged in for them to work, no batteries in it, so it's not portable without an outlet unless you get a car adapter with the right output.
Minor complaints to say the least lol. Great purchase. expand » « collapse

Pros: Sounds quality decent for wireless headphones Very comfortable Easy recharge with cradle Works well in my downtown office without interference
Cons: Kind of loose fitting, if you have a smaller head these might feel too "floppy" The BIG problem is that after 60 seconds or so the transmitter (base station) stops transmitting, and the headphones start hissing with static. Several posters have commented on this, and it's particularly bad for an office environment. Occasionally I pause the music to concentrate on something or have a quick chat with a co-worker, and then a blast of static hits my ears. Enough of a problem that I'm considering getting different headphones and selling these.
Listing these features here because they could be pros for some and con ... s for others: The fit is loose and comfortable, doesn't press against your ears. Doesn't block out sound or have noise canceling, so you can still hear your surroundings Volume range is wide, can go really quiet or very loud. When very quiet the quality suffers a bit, not much. expand » « collapse

Pros: Great Sound; Stylish; Lightweight
Cons: None for my use
