For the money and the sound these are perfect for me. They'll be used for watching TV after my wife is off to bed. Previously I had 3 cords plugged in tandem to get to my chair, the wireless makes those obsolete!

Pros: These fit pretty comfortably. Charging is really convenient, you just place them on the receiver. They are pretty lightweight.
Cons: The sound quality on these is ok, but not great. Another thing that I've noticed is that they seem to compress the level of the signal coming into them. I can tell that when I turn up my source, the volume of these don't increase at a 1:1 ratio. I find that a little annoying. Also, the transmitter seems to have a feature that automatically turns it on when it senses an incoming signal. Sometimes this doesn't trip and I have to unplug them from the source and plug them back in in order to get them to turn on.
I've owned another set of wireless headphones by a different manufacturer and these seem to be quite a bit better. I didn't ... really buy these and expect them to sound great, I bought them so that I could move around the house and play guitar and they work pretty well for that purpose. expand » « collapse

Pros: Only that I bought these on sale so I didn't waste too much money.
Cons: Terrible. I cannot get a clear signal on any channel. I have waited a few months to write this review in order to try possible fixes, but none have worked. They just suck.
To be more specific all audio varies from full of static, to being interspersed with loud cracks and static every few seconds. This makes them completely useless as any sort of audio device.
I live in my own house, with neighbors not very close at all. They don't even work properly in the same room as the base.
I have completely given up on wireless headphones for a while. It seems that the tech is just not there yet, or that you would have to spend several hundreds of dollars to get one that is.
If you nee ... d to walk about and do things while listening to music, I would suggest sticking with an mp3 player of your choice until another year goes by at least. expand » « collapse

Pros: Lightweight; Comfortable; Great Sound; Good Bass
this is a replacement for one we had before. a little different but basically the same. wish we could have had the other fixed but did not so purchased this one. nice for football as you can walk in the other room or even outside to bring the trash out and still hear the game. nice sound deafening so when someone talks to you you cannot hear them!!!

Item.ReviewTitle: Review: Sennheiser RS 120 Over-ear Wireless headphones
Item.Review: Good Points: Nice design - recharging takes place on the transmitter unit. Comfortable to wear. With their volume control I can have TV as loud as I like without deafening my wife.

Pros: Using them with my PC. Good distance when I walk around. Sound good, can't beat the price for wireless. Easy setup and charging. Not too heavy and build quality seems good.
Cons: A little loose on my head, so they tend to slide forward and backward if you look up or down too far. Hiss if sound source turns off or you get out of range.
This is my first pair of wireless, so next time I'll go for circumaural instead of these supra-aural style to help stay on my ears better.

Pros: It does work. However, caveats apply if you are using HDMI and an AVR. You cannot hook these to volume out on TV if it supplied by HDMI. I bought these for use on a ROKU XDs which has RCA and HDMI + WiFi. Perfect for English movies since most on NetFlix do not have CC. On DVD and most TV I can use CC, but then have to wear glasses. Getting old is tough so don’t laugh :). I then tried using them via the RCA on Dish receiver with HDMI installed. Worked great, wife can hear TV I use phones. Sound not cut off as when using jack on Pioneer Elite AVR. So I bought female - female RCA couplers, used an extra RCA set to Dish/DVD, not I can manually choose what I need
Cons: None that I can think of. It is the HDMI DRM that makes these hard to use. If you are not using HDMI, perfect.< ... br> Glad I bought these. Once I finally figured out the HDMI limitations, and chose to jury rig the set up, it was a breeze. On most movies that do not have sound tracks running in background I am fine. I also can enjoy the THX-SS system I installed on most occasions. Good for the noisy movies from Hollywood today expand » « collapse

Pros: They work.
Cons: Somewhat disappointed in sound quality. Only used 4 tv but occasional static and quality only so so. Controls somewhat difficult to find and get used to. They do not stay on easily and are not comfortable to wear. They do not cover the ear.
Got these for my father for xmas. He is very hard of hearing. I though he could use these without hearing aids but when they get loud enough for him to hear without the aids the static is too bad. He is 90 years old and too difficult for him to keep on ears and find the controls. The only plus is he can hear better with them and can turn off closed caption.

Pros: They sound great and have a long range to them. Plus with the multiple audio connectors that come with it they work on pretty much anything that outputs sound.
Cons: You have to keep adjusting the headset if you move about 2 to 3 inches from where you set it or you will start to hear alot of static. This starts to get really annoying after 10-15 min. so you cant really where them for a long time without having to keep fixing this issue.

Pros: -Convenient charging station -Good sound quality -Good range -Great battery life
Cons: -Uncomfortable -Bulky -Horrible blast of static after two or three minutes of inactivity
Unfortunately these are among the best wireless headphones available. I've used them every day for a year. They've held up well but they're far from perfect.
These are sized for someone with a giant head and fit loosely on my normal sized head. Yet they still manage to painfully pinch my ears. If I look down or tilt my head forwards too much they fall off. One day they're going to end up in the toilet.
Worse is the static blast others have mentioned. After 2-3 minutes of no signal the transmitter cuts out and the headphones begin blasting static. Be prepared to turn of ... f the headphones every time you pause something for two minutes. If you can remember.
Transmitter has three channels and headphones have a tuner, so I've had no trouble getting good clarity in or near the house.
Despite the drawbacks I'll keep using these until I can find a better set. For me the convenience of not being tied to the computer and knocking things over with the cord outweighs the comfort issues. expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: For $70 buck w/free shipping no brainer
Item.Review:
Pros: The Price! For anyone who has searched out a good to great headphone, this company makes them all (Although AR is coming along). Perfect Headphones for those that are realistic in what they expect. Expect a great set for the Price you pay
Cons: Everyone can come up with a Con, but is that really the headphones or we just wish something was different.
For $70 in the door, you cannot go wrong with this set or this company. I just purchased the RS180, as this unit is getting worn, but not a bit difference in sound in, oh, I guess about 2 years. Best bang for the buck. I just paid $218 on the RS180s, sorry not here, as the price is $299.95. The 160s dollar for dollar are the best out.

Pros: Fairly comfortable. Not too tight. Pretty good bass, not overpowering but not bad. Good set for $60. Newegg will probably remove the price I just listed.
Cons: The Auto Gain Control ruins the headphones when you listen to any sort of music at all. It is quieter in some parts than in others. I noticed others saying this too.
Maybe the other reviewers need to move their cordless phones or wireless routers but you can change the channels on the wireless router. Other wireless devices may be causing these to have static. I have no problems with that. I am right next to my wireless router and a cordless phone. The only thing I don't like is the auto volume gain control.(not mentioned here or on the website).

This works great on my TV but not that great on my computer while listening to music. The bass it weak and it took quite some time to find a good signal. Hint: Do not turn up the headphone volumne to max, unless you are using on a portable music device...that increases the signal strength and can cause hissing. Instead, turn up the volumne on the stereo receiver or TV instead,

I have a set of these. They work fine. I'm a little hard of hearing, and use them to watch TV. The only negative I have is that the TV audio has to be at a level the system will accept, otherwise it reverts to noise. That level is reasonably low. They do fall off my head when I bend over. Helpful hint: do not wear them on your head while you are washing dishes and moving a big cooking pot containing three inches of olive oil in the bottom. My headset fell off into the olive oil. I took it all apart, dumped it into soapy water, agitated it around for a few minutes and dried it in the sun. It worked great...for a couple of hours. Then it didn't, Tonight I am repeating the process, hoping I missed some grease the first time around. We'll see. Otherwise this little adventure will cost me [$] ... bucks. expand » « collapse

Pros: Great Sound. Great range.
Cons: Cannot lay down with my head on a pillow with these one.
I have owned these for 4+ years and I have always been pleased with their performance. I have not had the issues some of these others describe, which is why I felt compelled to write a review.

Pros: Sound quality is OK for the price (but not great). Good range - I can walk all through my apartment and this thing works.
Cons: When the connection breaks it blasts extremely loud static. This happens enough that, as far as I'm concerned, the headphones are unusable. I'm sending them back.

Pros: Excellent Sound Recharcheable Comfortable Extremely long reach
Cons: ABSOLUTELY NONE!
Since Im almost 55 I may not be able to hear the negatives others have listed. I use these when someones sleeping and it sounds close to my surround sound system. Ive had these almost 11 months and when I saw these advertised, I had to get them for my windows media center. Ive been using a wired USB 7.1 surround sound headset and have been very satisfied with them. But with this price and my experience with these, I'm now free of wires while watching my shows on the wmc. Will only be using the USBs only when videoconferencing. This is too good of an offer to refuse. I just wish the wife would get one, at least a wired type, so I dont have to listen to the junk she liste ... ns to. If you dont want to bother anyone, this is definately the choice. expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: Review: Sennheiser RS 120 Over-ear Wireless headphones
Item.Review:
Good Points: The sound quality is excellent with a good range.
Charging the headset is not difficult. Bad Points: The only bad point for me was the instructions. Things could be more explicit with better explanations. But it is not too
difficult to work out what is required.

Pros: I'm on my second pair now, and not because the first ones broke. The originals are still still going strong, some four years later. I needed the second for another location I work/play out of.
LONG range. I've been near static free over 200' away from the base station.
Rugged: Hundreds of hours of use, and they still look like the day I bought the original pair do.
Cons: Rechargeable batteries that came with them only lasted four years before replacement was required.
Seriously. You really, really can't go wrong. Great dynamic range, not too much bleed out of loud music or other noise for the on-ear set. Well worth it, long term.

Pros: These are great and a very good alternative to what is normally really expensive headphones. I researched wireless headphones for a long time before we purchased these and the definitely are the best for the price. Good range, good quality sound.
Cons: Feel a little cheap - but then again they are not $200 headphones.
We have problems with the tuner wheel moving and getting out of tune - but gorrilla tape fixed that easy enough.
Also, the head rest bar is a little weird and fits oddly - like it was engineered backwards.

Item.ReviewTitle: I woulkd buy the product again
Item.Review: I wear hearing aids however, they don't filter out the background TV noise. I use this product without the hearing aids and the sound comes through much clearer.

Pros: Good range. Fidelity is fair to good. Reasonable price. Not too large; smaller and lighter than the Sony MDR line.
Cons: Transmitter has manual switch for 3 broadcast frequencies. Receiver has a fine tuning dial to tune in on the broadcast frequency; it is manual and not automatic. At the best tuning, there is still a noticeable hiss. In some places in the house (e.g. in doorways) the sound fades in and out, like a dead zone. So the fidelity is only fair. But it is still well worth it for the freedom from a cord. The headphones are not tight on the head, and can easily slide around or off if you move your head to read the paper on your lap, wash dishes in the kitchen sink, etc. So don't think your gonna dance or do a workout with them on. Without excess activities they stay on ... fine. Despite these issues, I have no regrets and would buy them again.
I live in a 2000' 2-story tract house. Reception is good in every room and every corner of the lot, except in the doorways listed under CONS. The included rechargeable receiver batteries are NiMH AAA 1.2V 600 mAh. If and when they wear out I will replace them with 900-1100 mAh. expand » « collapse

Item.ReviewTitle: Great Distance & Quality. Go All Over The House!
Item.Review:
Pros: Excellent Range. Very good quality and range of sound.
Cons: Doesn't fully surround the ear, however comfort seems appropriate to use. $$$Price Tag is over-priced here. Seen for <75
Once you find the right channel & tune it accordingly, you can go anywhere. I have a 3-bedroom house, with up & down stairs--i went all over house and outside and they never cut out once! (2000sq/ft). Battery life seems pretty decent too. They take 2 AAA(ear piece twists off) Quality seems as good if not better than my previous Plantronics gamer headset, which i liked very much. Cons: The price for these headsets seems far too much...but i had a gift card i needed to use.

I labored for a number of weeks over this purchase. I really wanted a set of wireless headphones I could use with my Touch64GB while mowing the lawn or other activities around the house without having the wires wrapped around my head. This deal and much research caused me to jump. Just yesterday I hooked up the adapter after charging this headset for a day or more and plugged in the Pod, put on the phones and I was just amazed. I walked from room to room, downstairs, upstairs, 80 feet out into the yard and the sound quality was exceptional. I am really glad we got this headset. I did notice at one multi-walled juncture in the home that the headphones would sip just for a second, but this was the ONLY shift in sound quality. I simply can t believe have great they sound and how comfortable t ... hey are. expand » « collapse

I am happy with the quality and the price I paid for this wireless headphone. My only complain was that the instruction came in with many languages including English. Unfortunately the print was so small. Besides, that instruction was not clear on what and when to do things. I ended up throwing that sheet away and frustratingly figured it out myself. So, if you can do things without reading instruction, Go for it. This is good wireless headphone.

Purchased these to replace an older set from another manufacturer. Light weight, easy to set-up and to charge. I can now enjoy my programs more due to better hearing clarity, and lower volumes that won't disturb others. Added bonus, the headset has 3 frequency adjustments allowing you to listen in on phone calls on 900mhz portable phones.

Pros: Nice and light, easy to setup, good range even through several brick walls, comfortable for a long period of time, mostly used to listen to movies and the sound repro is excellent.
Cons: Can slip off my head to easily, but thats the price you pay for such a comfortable headset that doesn't surround your ear. If it clamped your head any firmer your ears would ache for sure, as it is the pads just rest on your ears. Sometimes they need retuning when the reception starts to crackle but thats really only a minor issue.
Very pleased. Sound repro is good although I mainly use them to listen to movies so I don't bother the rest of the house. On the odd occasion they can crackle and its possible in an location with...

Pros: Cost, good sound, and of course NewEgg :)
Cons: I purchased these for my father, who has extreme hearing loss. He enjoys watching TV, but the rest of the family can't hear anything but the TV if he is not wearing a headset. He had another pair (different brand) that finally wore out. This pair at high volume can be heard in the next room. If this is the reason why you are purchasing this headset, try another brand.
Works great for someone with average hearing. The tuning can be hard to adjust where it located. I prefer the type with channels.

The headphones are easy to use practically no setup. Charge the headphones by placing them on bracket then just plug into audio out jacks turn on headphones and your good to go. The sound quality was great no interference at all.

I have a hearing deficency and these headphones fix my problem for good quality sound. Sound range is good and batteries last a long time. I have two sets of these, one flor my computer and one for my tv.

We purchased these headphones to listen to the TV while running on a treadmill. At first we had a little bit of problem in tuning them to get the best sound with lowest hiss. We have a lot of wireless equipment and we had to experiment with the location of the base unit in order to get the best sound. The headphones are very light and stay put when running. The price point is great and we are happy with our purchase.

I use these headphones on my TV and am very satisfied with the overall operation. I was actually not expecting the quality of sound that these headphones produce. B&H has always been good to deal with and there competitive pricing keeps me coming back.

Pros: Easy as pie install, included rechargeable batteries. Great sound quality, good range.
Cons: head set is a tad heavy in my opinion, but my dad didn't think so... I guess its just that weight = quality a lot of the time.
Bought this as a Christmas gift to my father, boy he couldn't have been more excited. He's been using real cheapo ones that were beginning to die. He's been using these now for a few days and couldn't love them more.
Great for that dad who has to blast the TV to hear it. They make my mother happy most of all.

Item.ReviewTitle: Auto Gain Control ruins an otherwise good product.
Item.Review:
Pros: The wireless reception is decent and the earphones are pretty comfortable. Sound is great when it's not being automatically adjusted.
Cons: The Auto Gain Control (which was not advertised anywhere on Newegg or Sennheiser.com) ruins the headphones if you listen to any sort of dynamic music at all. It is completely unbearable, music is meant to be quieter in some parts than in others. I feel like I'm in Jr. High again and my mom is banging on the wall telling me to turn the music down, only now she's just adjusting the dial on her own.
The hiss is bad when volume is low, which is another product of the auto gain control. With only three channels and a limited tuning spectrum, these are not ideal for an apartment complex where there is a bunch of interference from mult ... iple sources.
I intend to seek a refund and look into a digital pair to avoid interference problems and will certainly make sure they do not have Auto Gain Control... what a worthless 'feature'. expand » « collapse

I ordered 2 units. One worked just fine, the other not at all. I have returned the non-working unit for a replacement not yet received[...] Since I use the product entirely for listening to the TV while using my treadmill, audiophile quality is not required or expected. I find the sound to be clear and pleasant. The unit is, however, significantly subject to interference when one is more than 30 or 35 feet away. The interference varies, so I have no fix on the cause. Within range of my treadmill, however, reception is flawless. For my purposes, the performance is adequate enough that I did not seek a refund for the defective unit, but asked for the same model as a replacement. My wife will use that one.

I use the RS-120 in my one level ranch style house when watching TV and these headphones pick up the audio flawlessly, no matter which room I am in. The padded ear cushions are flat and larger in diameter that one's ears, so if you do bend over, the headphones will tend to slide off your head. Wearing a baseball style cap helps to keep them in position, if need be. This is the style of ear cushion I wanted. I have no problem with the headphones sliding off when sitting and watching TV, or just walking from room to room. The adjustment buttons on the back of the headset are easy to work and once you get used to their locations, do not interfere with each other. The headphones are large in diameter and I knew that going in. These ARE just what I wanted! Above are some complaints I ... see often on the internet, but these headphones are great for my intended purpose. I highly recommend the RS-120. Great features and sound quality for the price. expand » « collapse
I use these headphones with my TV. I'm a hard of hearing and too frequently miss words when listening on the TV speakers. With these headphones I haven't missed a word.

Item.ReviewTitle: Excellent value with the RS120 headphones
Item.Review: I purchased the RS120 headphones so that we could watch TV late at night without disturbing the rest of the house. They serve that purpose very well, providing excellent signal reception with no interference from other devices. For the price, sound quality is great, particularly for general TV and movie watching. I haven t listened to music with these yet, but I imagine the quality is quite acceptable for an enjoyable, wire-free experience. Very comfortable headphones, too, although I do agree with another reviewer that more of a fitted feel on the ears would be preferable to the quot;flat quot; feel of these headphones. I debated between buying these or the RS130 headphones, and I m glad I didn t spend the extra cash on the next model (RS130). The manually adjustable signal tuner on the R ... S120 works very well, with a large tuning band that provides clear reception. I am very pleased with my purchase. expand » « collapse
